Handles make process for generating, viewing, and publishing images.

up_to_date(target)[source]

Check if the project is up to date by running a dry-run of the make process. Returns True if the project is up to date, False otherwise.

class preview_widget.PreviewWidget(main, name, settings, preview_mode, on_save, button_flags)[source]

Bases: TabPage

Widget for creating an image using a make process and (optionally) displaying it. Runs in two modes:

  • Preview Mode: - Generates small images for quick review in a simple image viewer.

  • Full Build Mode: - Generates large images. - Provides multiple features: “Create”, “View”, “Publish”, “Cancel”, “Clean”. - Uses external full-featured viewer due to large image size. - Large output window to monitor detailed build progress.

Methods:

cancel_for_out_of_date(action, target)[source]

Displays a confirmation dialog if the project is out of date.

Parameters:

  • action (str) – The name of the action (e.g., ‘Publish’, ‘View’) to display in the dialog.

  • target (str) – The name of the target

Returns:

True if out of date, and they cancel, False to proceed,

Return type:

bool

load_image(file_path)[source]

Load and display an image from the given file path. Adjust the zoom factor so the entire image fits within the self.image_label dimensions.

Parameters:

file_path (str) – Path to the image file.

Returns:

True on success

set_buttons_ready(ready)[source]

Enable or disable buttons based on the state. The cancel button takes the opposite state :param ready: Whether buttons should be enabled. :type ready: bool

use_error_layout(error)[source]

Adjust image size and output size based on whether an error occurred

zoom_image()[source]

Update the displayed image according to the current zoom factor.

preview_widget.launch_app(app_name, file_path, parent=None)[source]

Launches the specified application with the file and brings the app to the front.

Parameters:

  • app_name (str) – The name of the application to launch.

  • file_path (str) – The path to the file for the app

  • parent (QWidget, optional) – The parent widget for the error message dialog.

Raises:

  • FileNotFoundError – If the file does not exist.

  • OSError – If the operating system is not supported.

Context manager to suppress stderr output.
